rules.natural: Either the link between malaria and deforestation is confirmed, or if it is not the case that environmental change in the Amazon implies its detection by satellite imaging or aerial survey, then the correlation data is inconclusive.
Whenever satellite imaging detects deforestation in the Amazon, it triggers a Zika outbreak.
Under the condition that aerial survey detects deforestation in the Amazon, it triggers a Zika outbreak.
If a Zika outbreak in the Amazon basin is confirmed, then deforestation in the Amazon is an environmental change.
Supposing that environmental change in the Amazon does not result in its detection by satellite imaging or aerial survey, the correlation data is not inconclusive.
Under the condition that lab Alpha monitoring malaria does not imply it is in Europe, lab Beta is contaminated.

Provided that the satellite network is not operational or lab Alpha monitoring malaria not implying its Europe location does not cause lab Beta to be uncontaminated, the outbreak data is not verified.

If it is not the case that the absence of satellite network operation or the implication of lab Alpha's monitoring not requiring Europe location leading to lab Beta being uncontaminated results in verified outbreak data, then the global report is published.
In the event that deforestation in the Amazon does not trigger a Zika outbreak, lab Alpha monitors malaria.

facts.natural: An outbreak of Zika in the Amazon basin is confirmed.
It is not the case that lab Alpha is located in Europe.
The link between malaria and deforestation is not confirmed.
The satellite network is not operational.
The global report is not published.

target.natural: Deforestation in the Amazon triggers an outbreak of Zika.

Deforestation in the Amazon is detected by satellite imaging or by aerial survey.
Deforestation in the Amazon triggers an outbreak of Zika.

(A10 → (A7 ∨ A8)).natural: If deforestation in the Amazon is an environmental change, then either satellite imaging detects it or aerial survey detects it.

(A12 ∨ (¬(A10 → (A7 ∨ A8)) → A11)).natural: Either the link between malaria and deforestation is confirmed, or if it is not the case that environmental change in the Amazon implies its detection by satellite imaging or aerial survey, then the correlation data is inconclusive.

(A2 → A1).natural: Provided that lab Alpha monitors malaria, it is located in Europe.

(A4 ∨ (¬(A2 → A1) → ¬A3)).natural: Either the satellite network is operational, or if lab Alpha monitoring malaria does not necessitate it being in Europe, then lab Beta is not contaminated.

(A7 → G).natural: Whenever satellite imaging detects deforestation in the Amazon, it triggers a Zika outbreak.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Deforestation in the Amazon is detected by satellite imaging or by aerial survey.

(A8 → G).natural: Under the condition that aerial survey detects deforestation in the Amazon, it triggers a Zika outbreak.

(A9 → (A7 ∨ A8)).natural: If a Zika outbreak in the Amazon basin is confirmed, then deforestation there is detected by satellite imaging or aerial survey.

(A9 → A10).natural: If a Zika outbreak in the Amazon basin is confirmed, then deforestation in the Amazon is an environmental change.

(¬(A10 → (A7 ∨ A8)) → A11).natural: If environmental change in the Amazon does not lead to its detection by satellite imaging or aerial survey, then the correlation data is inconclusive.

(¬(A10 → (A7 ∨ A8)) → ¬A11).natural: Supposing that environmental change in the Amazon does not result in its detection by satellite imaging or aerial survey, the correlation data is not inconclusive.

(¬(A2 → A1) → A3).natural: Under the condition that lab Alpha monitoring malaria does not imply it is in Europe, lab Beta is contaminated.

(¬(A2 → A1) → ¬A3).natural: If lab Alpha monitoring malaria does not entail its location in Europe, then lab Beta is not contaminated.

(¬(A4 ∨ (¬(A2 → A1) → ¬A3)) → A5).natural: If it is not the case that the satellite network is operational or that lab Alpha monitoring malaria not implying its Europe location leads to lab Beta not being contaminated, then the outbreak data is verified.

(¬(A4 ∨ (¬(A2 → A1) → ¬A3)) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that the satellite network is not operational or lab Alpha monitoring malaria not implying its Europe location does not cause lab Beta to be uncontaminated, the outbreak data is not verified.

(¬(¬(A4 ∨ (¬(A2 → A1) → ¬A3)) → A5) → A6.natural: If it is not the case that the absence of satellite network operation or the implication of lab Alpha's monitoring not requiring Europe location leading to lab Beta being uncontaminated results in verified outbreak data, then the global report is published.

(¬G → A1).natural: If deforestation in the Amazon does not trigger a Zika outbreak, then lab Alpha is located in Europe.
